name: Alexander Pink
title: 189,424,977 bytes, 17,853,774 bytes, 68,545,869 bytes
description: Three books generated with command line and InDesign scripting exploring artifacts generated from repeatedly compressing an image.

name: Alexander Pink
title: 2,433,707 bytes, 157,259,377 bytes, and 32,577,217 bytes
description: Various clips from three experiments in datamoshing accompanied by original sound.

name: Alexander Pink
title: 1,842,910 bytes and 1,833,762 bytes
description: Two generated posters showing degradation from generation loss along the Y axis and downsampling in resolution along the X axis.

name: Allie Heffner
title: Family Reunion
description: Laser cut image on plywood, sourced from the Internet Archive.

name: Allie Heffner
title: Happy Birthday
description: Laser cut image on plywood, sourced from the Internet Archive.

name: Allie Heffner
title: Land Reclamation: an expansive guide on how Hong Kong did it
description: 3 in 1 book about the 1997 handover from British to Chinese rule in Hong Kong.

name: Allie Heffner
title: Exercise Book
description: An exploration of the many forms that patterns can take.

name: Allie Heffner
title: Untitled
description: Riso zine

name: Ameer Tarawneh
title: Fetish
description: I believe it speaks for itself.

name: Ameer Tarawneh
title: Missing
description: A proclamation worthy of a headline breaks through those boundaries, and begins to sink towards the earth from its own weight.

name: Ameer Tarawneh
title: EGO
description: A short film of sorts dedicated to EGO, a gay club right here in Providence, and its many patrons i’ve come to befriend over the years.

name: Ameer Tarawneh
title: Artwork for "The Saint of the Slaughterhouses“ ”
description: Designed for a RISD Wintersession production of the aforementioned play. Inspired by 20th century Polish film posters.

name: Anaïs Reiss
title: Error 404 Riso Paper Clock
description: A risograph paper clock made for Howful Studio.

name: Angelina Kirincic
title: A Guide to the Soul GIF
description: Originally a postcard that was intended to evoke the sonic qualities and convey the character of soul music only using typographic elements, this image was converted to 125 physical Risograph frames, then compiled together again to produce a GIF.

name: Angelina Kirincic
title: From the Soul
description: Interactive printed book with RISO foldouts detailing the origins and legacy of Soul Music.

name: April Sujeong Lim
title: Out Of Order
description: Photozine documenting my life in&around college

name: Ashley Ha
title: on the other side of the gate
description: pauses in between, leaving what's gone

name: Ashley Ha
title: An Interview With Natalie Shields
description: An editorial interview spread that visually mirrors a playful conversation.

name: Ashley Ha
title: Toronto 2014
description: Inspired by Daniel Caesar and Mustafa

name: Bowen Li
title: Nostalgia
description: Do you see your childhood inside

name: Caleb Wu
title: The Game Just Evolves
description: N/A

name: Caleb Wu
title: A CONVERSATION WITH CORINNE ANG
description: A conversation with Corinne Ang the designer behind the iconic Sundae Flowers, come dive into her design process and discover the creative strategies behind her work and Sundae Flowers.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Neon Museum Identity
description: The Neon Museum is a Las Vegas based institution dedicated to preserving and showcasing the city’s iconic neon signs. This identity explores how light, history, and place can inform a contemporary identity for a cultural institution rooted in the city’s visual legacy.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Vectorbloom
description: Vectorbloom is an interactive typeface made on p5.js that transforms letters into points, blooming with motion and responding to your touch. Through this project I used few lines of code to make a typeface that can have various forms and can also be applied to various mediums including print and 3D.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Himeji Castle Identity
description: Himeji Castle is a UNESCO World Heritage Site in Japan, known for its preserved architecture and layered defensive design. Often called the White Heron Castle, it stands as a symbol of strength, precision, and restraint. This identity project translates the castle’s form and history into a contemporary visual system. The focus was on honoring its cultural significance while creating an identity that feels timeless, quiet, and enduring.

name: Chahak Surana
title: RECEIPT OF PRESENCE
description: This piece interprets the @ symbol as a connector between people, places, and moments. Using the format of a receipt, it records fragments of digital communication such as emails, pauses, and unsent thoughts rather than purchases. Lines like me@sunrise or you@coffee become traces of presence. Printed on fabric, the work turns fleeting online exchanges into something physical and lasting, reflecting how connection today is brief and layered.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Navigating Typography
description: This project examines contemporary typographic signage through the lens of El Lissitzky’s typographic theories. Presented as a print publication, it brings together two of Lissitzky’s essays with examples of signage design to explore how typography guides movement, attention, and meaning in space. Through the pairing of text, images, and format, the project highlights how Lissitzky’s ideas continue to shape how we navigate information today.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Panchali Serif
description: Panchali Serif is a typeface inspired by The Palace of Illusions, a novel that retells an ancient Indian epic from the perspective of its female protagonist, Draupadi. The typeface features contrast between thick and thin strokes, delicately curved terminals, and wide proportions that give it a graceful yet commanding presence.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Track It
description:
Track It is an event-based campaign that educates students about Measurement Based Care (MBC) through activity-based participation. MBC is a type of therapy in which a patient fills out a survey such as the GAD-7 (The Generalized Anxiety Disorder-7 test is a quick, 7-question self-report screening tool used to measure the severity of anxiety symptoms) each session which can be used to track their changes and progress over time. This initiative aims to raise awareness, educate, and increase participation by encouraging people to be curious about this form of therapy using a positive and memorable tone.
Collaborated with Ella Goodman.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Climate Change Data Visualization
description: This poster visualizes climate change data through an infographic poster. Starting from researched datasets, the design translates complex and often dry information into a clear and accessible visual format. The goal is to make the data easier to understand while highlighting the scale and urgency of climate change.

name: Chahak Surana
title: desi-gned issue 3
description: desi–gned is New England's first publication for the South Asian diaspora: a compilation of the living archives of ingenious craftsmanship, subaltern histories, and current contemplations, of untold stories that need to be shared. Issue 3 explores what we carry across time, place and memory.

name: Chahak Surana
title: BRACES FONT
description: This is an interactive font made on p5.js. The code includes 20 curly brackets and whenever one set of braces is removed from the code the font changes. As more braces are removed the font becomes difficult to read showing the importance of braces in a code.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Motion Studies
description: This project is a series of animated studies that explore the relationship between motion and sound. Each looping animation responds to a specific musical concept, using movement, timing, and form to visually interpret the accompanying soundtrack. The studies progress from percussion and tonality to the quality of sound, ending with a final animation that breaks the loop and resolves the series.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Frame by Frame Animation
description: This is a frame by frame animation consisting of 25 frames which responds to the song Remember When by Wallows. All the frames are hand drawn and the animation goes with the beat and rhythm of the song.

name: Chahak Surana
title: Falling Blocks
description: This is an animation rendered on Cinema4D which shows type with wooden textures falling like Jenga.

name: Chahak Surana
title: 3D ANIMATION
description: These are a bunch of videos I rendered on Cinema 4D during my 3d digital design workshop

name: Chahak Surana
title: Paper Clip Font
description: This is an experimental typeface made out of paper clips. Each letter is made by using paper clips and scanned on a scanner.

name: Chelsea Liu
title: Lettered Entities
description: Lettered Entities is created from a study of how typographic forms appear in every day life. With Hammett Nurosi's expert guidance, this object reflects our collective interest in an hands-on experience.

name: Chelsea Liu
title: Our Aesthetic Categories
description: In Typography 3, students were asked to typeset a chapter from Sianne Ngai’s work and including an interview with a classmate. I chose to explore the ways in which my classmate chooses to show their own design ethos through their work. With guidance from Kathy Wu.

name: Chelsea Liu
title: The World Through Words
description: This is the instruction pamphlet of a board game in conversation with an Animist Manifesto. In our own manifesto, we created an experience for players to build their own stories of the existence of a language. Board game concept developed with Zimo Yang, with guidance from Pouya Ahmadi.

name: Coco (Yuxuan) Li
title: About Time
description: About Time explores the tension between personal and historical perceptions of time. Drawing from David Rooney's essay About Time and Marcel Proust's In Search of Lost Time, the book overlays the objective history of timekeeping with subjective experiences of memory. Utilizing semi-transparent vellum, the design allows these narratives to interact visually, creating a layered effect by examining how time is measured, remembered, and inevitably fades.

name: Coco (Yuxuan) Li
title: CULT · US Magazine
description: CULT · US Magazine examines the societal impact of cult cinema through a feminist lens. Derived from Latin cultus—merging "cult" and "us", it explores how these films resonate with marginalized voices. The debut issue focuses on women's representation in witch films, blending immersive design with a gothic aesthetic across both print and digital formats.

name: Coco (Yuxuan) Li
title: In/Out of Focus
description: In/Out of Focus is a transmedia design project exploring the power inherent in the camera as an object. Drawing formal and material inspiration from film strips, the series is presented as a diptych poster. In Focus traces the evolution of photography, while Out of Focus exposes the hidden power dynamics embedded in the act of seeing and being seen.

name: Constance Benford
title: Ain’t I a woman
description: Aint I a Woman explores Black femininity and how it is perceived through technology, social media, and culture. It confronts the systemic disregard of Black women’s contributions and the stereotypes that continue to oppress them.

name: Ella Goodman
title: Seer
description: Stop-motion animation of an artist in a creative rut.

name: Ella Goodman
title: Snap
description: A 3d-printed typeface for spelling, building, or playing.

name: Ella Goodman
title: Olympic National Park
description: A visionary branding project for Olympic National Park, a UNESCO World Heritage Site that is located on Washington’s Olympic Peninsula. The park is exceptionally ecologically diverse, as it is made up of several distinct types of forests. The brand identity explores the three major ecosystems and animals that bring millions of visitors to the park each year.

name: Emily Gray Hook
title: It’s All About Remembering, Just To Try And Forget Again
description: Each of life’s events, those we remember, those we forget, those we wish to remember, and those we wish to forget, have all shaped us into who we are today. It's All About Remembering, Just To Try And Forget Again, holds space for the memories we wish to forget, acknowledging their existence and place in shaping who we are today, while celebrating their passing.

name: Emily Kwak
title: Love You Lots
description: Inspired by archives of letters from loved ones that recall meaningful past memories, this poster evokes feelings of nostalgia and positive emotions.

name: Emily Kwak
title: Oz and Alice Hybrid Book
description: This book brings together two class stories and plays with typography as image to visually respond to the events of each story.

name: Emily Kwak
title: Interview with Min hee Lee
description: An interview with a graphic designer, translating thoughtful conversation into a newspaper format inspired by book spreads.

name: Grace Liu
title: A City: Loud & Quiet.
description: A City: Loud & Quiet. gathers three pieces of text around the sound of New York City in the form of a long accordion book with playful, dynamic typesetting.

name: Henie Hyewon Cho
title: WHY WE DON'T FEEL SEXY ANYMORE
description: Inspired by Catherine Shannon’s essay, Your Phone is Why You Don’t Feel Sexy, the book consists of six curated essays and 20+ images to guide you to, hopefully, feel sexy again.

name: Henie Hyewon Cho
title: Jazzy Lovers
description: The Jazzy Lovers reflect on the mischievous nature of love!

name: Henie Hyewon Cho
title: In Vain
description: Image transfer and gesso on wood

name: Henie Hyewon Cho
title: Girl Archive
description:
Split into girl objects and girl quotes, readers can pair together whatever resonates
with their girl soul

name: Hyunjo Lee
title: Interview with Min Hee Lee
description: A newspaper design based on an interview with Professor Min Hee Lee.

name: Hyunmin Kim
title: Rectangles
description: A book featuring three essays—on grid systems, the golden ratio, and Zaha Hadid

name: Hyunmin Kim
title: Cuba Country Data
description: Information graphics about Cuba.

name: Hyunmin Kim
title: Channa Horwitz
description: This trailer website showcases a hypothetical exhibition of artist Channa Horwitz.

name: Hyunmin Kim
description: A study of grids

name: Hyunmin Kim
title: Mohawk Paper Identity
description: Rebranding project for Mohawk Paper

name: Hyunmin Kim, James Burgat
title: Serious Designers
description: We examined our collections as a whole to understand how they shape our creative process and to clarify what defines us as designers.

name: Izana Nordhaus
title: Where Did My Time Go In 2024?
description: An interactive pop-up book translating one year of personal time-tracking productivity data into a touchable object.

name: Izana Nordhaus
title: Carousel Lyric Video
description: A lyric motion graphic video for the song Carousel by Laufey.

name: Izana Nordhaus
title: Little Things
description: A rebrand of Chobani Creations inspired by its origins, craft, and playfulness.

name: Izana Nordhaus
title: Form In Motion
description: A conceptual title sequence and brand design for a Swiss design documentary, exploring narrative through one evolving animated form.

name: Izana Nordhaus
title: Your Year In Health
description: A proposed Apple Health concept that turns a year of personal health data into an immersive, reflective motion experience.

name: Janice Lee
title: Texture of Sound
description: An interactive sketch that turns live sound into a spinning vinyl, transforming noise into visible traces. The final work features laser-cut acrylic discs, each linked by QR code to its digital version.

name: Janice Lee
title: BRINK
description: In BRINK’s debut issue, The Edge of Utopia and Dystopia, the magazine examines the thin line between ideal futures and imagined collapse through three articles and one interview. Printed on newsprint and long stitch bound.

name: Janice Lee
title: Silent Trails
description: This interactive website visualizes the hidden buildup of lunar space debris and its growing risk to future missions. Users explore a 3D Moon surrounded by color-coded debris, track changes over 60 years with a timeline slider, and view real-time orbital paths with historical mission context. Hand-coded in HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.

name: Janice Lee, Kay Kim, Rachel Shin
title: What Was Once There
description: With the turn of the 22nd century, What Was Once There becomes an archaeological exhibition from the future, curating artifacts from 2050 to 2100 that trace the events leading to our present. The collection includes Hand-Sweep Pollinator, Star Drone, Welcome to Venice, and A Man’s Drinking Pipe. Together, these objects reveal a speculative world shaped by environmental collapse, technological dependence, and human survival. Scan each QR code to learn more.

name: JB LeGrange
title: Building Type
description: Building Type is a website that combines a digitized LEGO building experience with typographical techniques.

name: JB LeGrange
title: The Anatomy of Adaptation
description: A duo of posters tracing the arc of adaptation and loss, juxtaposing the abstracted anatomy of a dragonfly against a conversation between a father and son.

name: Jinhang Xiao
title: Clostra Son Jon Müstair Identity Book
description: The two books explore the historical heritage of Müstair and its relationship with UNESCO. They combine texts from the site about its history and UNESCO's mission statement.

name: Jinhang Xiao
title: Greentopia
description: A multipage website comes from a mapping team project, investigating what a greenhouse truly is. By gathering both deliberate human interventions and uncontrolled organic remnants, we reimagined the greenhouse not as a stable space, but as a constructed idea shaped by desire, aesthetics, and entropy.

name: Jinhang Xiao
title: Lumimoria website
description: A multipage website leads readers from the opening interactions into the world of instant photography, the excitement of innovation, and the legacy of a company that changed the way we see.

name: Hyunjo Lee
title: Echoes of Light
description: A book exploring painter Claude Monet’s artistic journey and evolution.

name: Joanna Yeonjin Cho
title: Normal Archive
description: Normal Archive is a performative archive created from public survey responses. It examines what is considered “normal” in our society and what that idea excludes. Rather than treating normality as neutral or universal, the project approaches “normal” as a socially constructed set of standards. This book is a collection of responses gathered in January 2026.

name: Joanna Yeonjin Cho
title: normalarchive.com
description: normalarchive.com records responses from the public in real time. It is a performative and collaborative archive that explores how people understand and define “normal.”

name: Joanna Yeonjin Cho
title: Knotline
description: Knotline explores how ordinary materials can become typographic systems. Each character is built from a physical shoelace, preserving its wiggle, tension, and softness.

name: Katie Hwang
title: In the Shadow of Minari
description: A movie script book featuring the script and music of Minari, reimagined as a tribute to immigrants who journey across oceans carrying hope, uncertainty, and the dream of building a new home.

name: Katie Hwang
title: Changdeokgung Identity Project
description: A research-driven branding and book design project exploring Changdeokgung Palace as a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

name: Katie Hwang
title: New Optics of Hangul and Typography
description: Study of Hangul through the experimental typographic principles inspired by El Lissitzky, exploring how letterforms can function as both language and visual structure.

name: Katie Hwang
title: National Inventors Museum
description: Brand Identity design for the National Inventors Museum. Inspired from blue prints.

name: Katie Hwang, Maggie Xian, Rachel Shin
title: The Epitaph Project (Group Project)
description: The Epitaph Project begins with mapping the historical site of the Sprague family lot at Swan Point Cemetery in Providence, Rhode Island, and culminates in an interactive website that asks users to consider: How do you want to be remembered?

name: Kay Kim
title: Citype
description: Citype is an experimental typographic project that translates the city into letterform, treating urban space as a language shaped through collective existence. Through dense line-based illustration, the project explores how architectural structures and spatial relationships can be read typographically.

name: Kay Kim
title: Not Everything Is Measured
description:
From the moment we are born, we are constantly measured—whether intentionally or not.
Our physical conditions, emotional states, even our place in society. Sometimes it‘s
uncomfortable but also in other times, it helps us understand ourselves. But what matters
most is not forcing ourselves to fully conform to those standards. Not everything can be
explained with numbers. What truly matters often can’t be measured at all.

name: Kay Kim
title: Poem Machine
description:
The Poem Machine is a participatory device that invites users to act as both poet
and graphic designer. Made with polymer and plywood, It invites users to
puzzle pieces, roll the ink, and press the paper to create their own unique
printed poems.

name: Kira Karafotas
title: An Index of Female Designers
description: This is my independent study I did with Lucy Hitchcock. I interviewed 10 female designers about their experiences as designers and who and what influenced them.

name: Kira Karafotas
title: I wish Ana Mendieta was still alive
description: This poster is about Ana Mendieta’s art and life, as well as female artists being silenced.

name: Kira Karafotas
title: El Lissitzky Texts & Political Posters
description: This is a zine that folds out into a poster. It features political posters paired with El Lissitzky's texts: Typographical facts & Topography of typography.

name: Kira Karafotas
title: proof of devotion
description: This lyric book pairs Mitski’s song “I’m Your Man” with images of destruction caused by fire.

name: Kira Karafotas
title: running dogs
description: Relief linoleum prints of dogs running.

name: Kira Karafotas
title: i want to be in the woods at night
description: Collection of 12 wood relief prints.

name: Kira Karafotas, Nada Rodanant, Willow Baker
title: Dialectical Technofutures Second Publication
description: This dos-à-dos is the second publication in our Dialectical Technofutures project. One side features the texts “The Poetic Web” by Chia Amisola and “Becoming Human by Design” by Tony Fry. The other side is a flag book featuring submissions from RISD students about finding community online. NFC tags embedded behind each fingerprint link to the students’ audio recordings.

name: Kira Karafotas
title: oh ok
description: oh ok

name: Kristen Sun
title: Digital Space
description: A few days of computer screen-time, software categories, locations, and embodied feelings are translated into a rotating sphere and soundscape. Projected at scale, the work turns everyday overuse into a clear, immersive portrait of how digital labor reshapes time, mood, and physical rhythm—inviting viewers to notice what the screen quietly takes.

name: Maggie Xian
title: Notes on “Camp” & Zuleika Dobson
description: A hybrid book blending the texts of Susan Sontag’s essay Notes on “Camp” and Max Beerbohm’s satirical novel Zuleika Dobson. Thinking about what constitutes tasteful design, it is typeset for a delightfully uncomfortable reading experience.

name: Maggie Xian
title: How to Develop B+W Film
description: This vector-illustrated poster demonstrates how black and white film is developed in the darkroom. The process is broken down into 16 steps, with the first 4 steps being completed in total darkness. The development times are based upon recommendations for Ilford HP5 Plus at 20°C — and hence, the design is intentionally reminiscent of Ilford packaging.

name: Maggie Xian
title: Voyager Type Specimen
description: A soft, yet steady text serif, initially designed for Antoine de Saint-Exupéry’s novella, The Little Prince. Voyager is low-contrast and highly legible in smaller sizes, but its gentle serifs and ligatures maintain character when used for bigger headings (or, the larger text of a children’s book).

name: Maggie Xian
title: No Light Without Darkness
description: No Light Without Darkness is a photobook of B+W film photography taken and processed by me. White toner printed on black paper, french fold binding with partial dust jacket.

name: Marie You
title: Aesthetic Conversations
description: A french-fold publication presenting 2 parallel conversations. In Our Aesthetic Categories, Adam Jasper interviews cultural critic and feminist scholar Sianne Ngai on postmodern cultural aesthetic categories; in Classmate Interview, designer and classmate Ryan Scott speaks on his personal practice and aesthetic. Supplementary images and scans of Ryan’s laptop stickers provide an additional dimension.

name: Marie You
title: In Search of Light
description: Poster featuring a series of closeups generated by experimenting with the now discontinued 3D feature in Photoshop.

name: Marie You
title: Thoroughfare [I], [II], [III]
description: A multi-media, multi-textural experimental project mapping the personal geography of an overworked graphic design major’s daily commute. A disorienting reimagination of the RISD landscape made in Google Earth Pro manifests as a series of stills (Thoroughfare [I]), a digital/analog hybrid short film ((Thoroughfare [II]), and a hand-bound, hand-printed poetry book (Thoroughfare [III]).

name: Marie You
title: Zombies Don’t Fall In Love (僵尸没有爱情)
description: On Chinese social media, internet bots are colloquially referred to as “zombies” (僵尸号) because of how they algorithmically generate content in an effort to appear human, but can’t quite get it right. When bot posts are just a regurgitation of real human input lost to time and the vastness of the internet, where do we draw the line between creator and creation? This risograph zine explores such tension by recontextualizing accidentally poetic bot posts as love letters, juxtaposing them against archival type specimens, illustrations, and photography.

name: Marie You
title: Let there be light
description: Experimentation with Illustrator and Photoshop effects and textures.

name: Nada Rodanant
title: PSYCHO
description: A book that combines the famous horror, Psycho novel and movie script. Intro pages acts like movie title sequence . Theme of repetition and sequential images is repeated throughout the book.

name: Nada Rodanant
title: El Lissitzky On Type + Books
description: A book about typography that combines the texts: Topography of Typography and Typographical Facts by El Lissitzky, providing examples of books that relates to the typographic theories in the texts. The book can be read from both sides.

name: Nada Rodanant
title: GumGirl
description: GumGirl’s identity plays with the idea of girlhood and the grotesque; the experience of being a girl is beautiful and silly (I’m just a girl) but also carries its hardships and painful realities. The book features a collection of quotes from famous feminist literature and films, presenting it in a pop brightly-colored satirical meme-style whilst touching upon deeper themes of womanhood, femininity, the female body, and fetishization of women.

name: Nadine Macapagal
title: Problem Library
description: "Water, water everywhere, but not a drop to drink"

name: Nadine Macapagal
title: Objects for General Use
description: A collection of standardized objects presented as tools for general use

name: Nadine Macapagal
title: Skeleton Leaf Alphabet
description: An alphabet made from a skeleton leaf

name: Nadine Macapagal
title: A punctuation stool,
description: ...built for pauses

name: Nadine Macapagal
title: Documentation studies
description: Three posters that document v.1

name: Narin Kim
title: Heewon
description: Heewon is a bilingual book that highlights the works of Jung Youngsun, a pioneering South Korean landscape architect who shaped modern landscape design and botanical planning in the country. The book features 55 of Jung’s projects, categorized by theme and cultural impact.

name: Narin Kim
title: Heewon Typeface
description: A zine showcasing the modular typeface Heewon, a system derived from Jung Youngsun’s botanical landscape sketches. The organic forms were reinterpreted and transformed into a structured modular typeface, blending natural inspiration with geometric precision.

name: Narin Kim, Seoyeon Kweon, Rachel Lee
title: Sakini Studio
description: Sakini is a self-initiated brand project that reimagines tattoo culture through minimal, wearable design. Blending accessibility with individuality, the project explores tattoo stickers and objects as tools for personal expression, inviting audiences to interact, collect, and carry the brand beyond the exhibition space.

name: Natalie Ho
title: Studio HanLi: On Systems, Play, and Practicing Both
description: Studio HanLi approaches design in a playful, “heuristic” way, specializing in graphic design, typography, and bespoke typefaces. I had the greatest pleasure of interviewing them and asking about their practice.

name: Natalie Ho
title: Where’s the Green?
description: How can we re-introduce greenery into a city that wasn’t built for thriving life? How can we find joy amidst the urban chaos?

name: Natalie Ho
title: Yellowstone National Park Identity
description: This rebrand takes inspiration from Yellowstone’s vast geography and natural hydrothermal and geologic features.

name: Olivia Wiser
title: Quite a Lot of Blue
description: The full text of the poetry book Bluets, by Maggie Nelson, in the form of of a hand-bound accordion fold book. The transformation of the book as a shrine to the color blue.

name: Peiqian (Bailey) Song
title: An Apple A Day
description:
A girl lives with her caring but
overbearing mother, who insists on
giving her an apple every morning
to take t o school. What appears to
be a simple act of care gradually
becomes an emotional burden,
symbolizing expectations,
unspoken pressure, and the tension in their relationship.

name: Rachel Shin
title: The Angel in The Machine
description: A zine about how angels mimic machines.

name: Rachel Shin
title: The Five Laws of Library Science /  Edible Forest Gardens
description: This publication aims to garden this relationship between the forest and the library.

name: Rachel Shin
title: Stay for a While: Diners and Izakayas
description: A book about when eating out was once comfort and routine, not luxury. Table of contents, as well as chapter dividers, mimic server order pads, with handwritten typography. Typeset in ABC Marist and GT Pressura, photos taken on Sony A6100 at Louis Family Restaurant in Providence, RI.

name: Rachel Shin
title: Victor Wembanyama: [Alien?]
description: Motion graphics for 7 foot 5 inch NBA star Victor Wembanyama, nicknamed the “Alien.”

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Untitled (Digital playground)
description: Digital nostalgia, dream worlds, and friendship!

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: run-on
description: Rambles.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Superstition, Superstition, Superstition
description: Beliefs and systems.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Nahidlaw Ako Sa Imo
description: Language/distance/learning.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Motion Reel
description: Some things I made move.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: 24FPS
description: Experimental publication.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Plus One
description: Campaign to spotlight Pinoy creatives.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Self Declaration
description: Series of poems and questions.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: American Dream: Pilot Episode
description: Interrogating what the American Dream is.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Gummy Words
description: Fun to look at, not to eat.

name: Rafael Mediodia
title: Input:Output
description: Tests.

name: Renee Zhu
title: The Craft of Writing
description: “The Craft of Writing” explores writing methods and tools across different cultures and historical periods through a collage-style composition

name: Renee Zhu
title: The Art of Writing
description: "The Art of Writing" celebrates the beauty of Chinese calligraphy through a collection of scripts.

name: Ryan Scott
title: Fall 2025 RISD GD Speaker Series
description: A risograph poster installation for the Fall 2025 RISD GD Speaker Series.

name: Ryan Scott
title: I'm With Stupid
description: Lace crochet t-shirt design.

name: Ryan Scott
title: Artist / Athlete
description: A multimedia, spiral-bound book about the history of basketball at RISD during the 1960s.

name: Ryan Scott
title: Mexico 1968 Chair
description: A plywood chair modeled after the Mexico 1968 Summer Olympics visual identity system.

name: Ryan Scott
title: Sentimental Value House
description: A vector illustration of the home seen in the film "Sentimental Value".

name: Sarah Qianyin Feng
title: Pingyao Ancient City
description: Founded in the 14th century, Pingyao is an exceptionally well-preserved example of a traditional Han Chinese city, reflecting five centuries of urban planning and architectural evolution. Rather than replicating historical forms, this rebrand reinterprets Pingyao through a contemporary lens. Through a refreshed visual system and a bilingual (Chinese–English) branding strategy, the project injects youthful energy while remaining rooted in cultural heritage.

name: Seoyeon Kweon
title: Hygge (Is Not an Object)
description:
Hygge (Is Not an Object) examines hygge as something that cannot be owned or displayed.
Using layered images and subtle text, the work centers on time, presence, and everyday moments that pass gently and without record.

name: Seoyeon Kweon
title: Collected Habits
description: Everyday connection, shaped by repetition and time.

name: Shiyan Zhu
title: Feast on My Fear
description: Swallow my pain and feast on my fear.

name: Shiyan Zhu
title: The Ocean of  Pixels
description: This project presents an interview with multidisciplinary artist, designer and writier Somnath Bhatt. The conversation explores Bhatt’s intuitive creative practice, rooted in drawing and emotional experience, alongside his thoughts on identity, symbolism, and how personal and professional work intersect.

name: Shiyan Zhu
title: 行 (hanng 4)
description:
In Cantonese, 行 (hanng 4) means “to walk” or “to keep going.” Rooted in this notion, the book traces an inner monologue of becoming, in which an unnamed self moves through cycles of distance and return—finding reconciliation in quiet reckoning, a fragile yet tender sense of belonging, and a steady resolve to wander beyond the known world.

Through reconstructed photographs and redefined risograph color, the work reimagines memory as a layered, tactile space, where color becomes a vessel for intimacy between departure and return.

name: Shiyan Zhu
title: TOMB
description: This book takes readers on a journey through time, guided by scripts from two ancient tombs: Mawangdui in China and the Tomb of Ankhmahor in Egypt. The Mawangdui tombs, dating back to the Han Dynasty, contain philosophical and medical works, including the Dao De Jing, while the Egyptian tomb offers insights into daily life, beliefs, and the afterlife. By juxtaposing these two cultures, the book explores their views on mortality, health, and the cosmos.

name: Tiffany Tsan
title: Almost Love
description:
Almost Love is a hand-drawn, emotionally layered book that captures the yearning, confusion, and tenderness of love in all its messiness. Designed to be reshuffled, its pages are filled with fragmented imagery and vulnerable text, reflecting the nature 
of longing. The cover, resembling a hand-drawn envelope, and the handwritten letters throughout reinforce the intimacy of love letters. Scattered within are clear envelopes, blank pages, pressed flowers, and stickers with poetry, which are all interactive details that invite the reader to customize, collage, and make the book their own.

name: Willow Baker
title: Orlando Darling
description: Orlando Darling combines Orlando by Virginia Woolf and Candy Darling, by Candy Darling. The project maps gender and intimacy through a system which places type and images in relation to their perceived femininity vs. masculinity and their proximity to the author.

name: Willow Baker
title: Laura Coombs Interview
description: An interview with designer Laura Coombs on Cyberfeminism, book design, and everything falling into place.

name: Zenie Lu
title: The Story of Chinese Tea Brick
description: This coptic-bound book, crafted with tea leaf–embedded paper inspired by ancient Chinese tea brick packaging, invites readers to experience the culture of tea through multiple senses. Through the scent of the paper, bilingual storytelling, illustration, packaging, and the tactile texture of each page, it transforms Chinese tea culture into an intimate encounter, one that can be seen, touched, and felt beyond words. Blending design, memory, and heritage, it reflects my personal relationship to Chinese culture, where tea becomes a medium for tracing identity, tradition, and the passage of time.

name: Zihan Feng
title: Sight&Sound
description: A Magazine to explore depth in movies. Volume #1focus on the Blade Runner, talks about love and human rights of artificial humans.

name: Zimo Yang
title: Tracing Eons
description: A two-part project containing a pair of info posters and an accompanying set of experimental books. Conceptually, it is personal reflection on the current state of the Earth as well as its unfathomable history.

name: Zimo Yang
title: Chitin & Pleats
description: A modular zine combining my personal interests in paper-folding and bugs: an introductory text + a selection of original origami designs with folding instructions for each. Similar to a work of origami, the sections of this zine can themselves be unfolded and re-folded.

name: Zimo Yang
title: Elaborate Dreams
description: An ongoing attempt to collect a selection of my work in poetry from the past five years into a book. Its contents are varied and rather personal, including reflections on individual growth, interpersonal connections, and spiritual beliefs as they all oscillate back and forth.
